ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: The LiDAR PointCloud 3D Demo showcases rendering of LiDAR composite data of a region (Central London) with SciChart.
ExampleDefinition.Description:
LiDAR data can be collected from a variety of sources: UAV drones (Unmanned Aerial Vehicles), self-driving cars, geological survey tools and more.
It can be used in a variety of scenarios: anything from defence/tactical operations to geological survey such as energy/mining, geospatial analysis, civil engineering, construction and more.
The LiDAR PointCloud 3D Demo showcases rendering of LiDAR composite data of Central London as a 3D Point Cloud chart using SciChart. The 3D Point Cloud chart is defined by the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Model.XyzDataSeries3D%603.html']XyzDataSeries3D[/url] and the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.RenderableSeries.ScatterRenderableSeries3D.html']ScatterRenderableSeries3D[/url]. A texture is drawn at each individual point to allow a high-performance solution allowing many points.
More info about creation of this demo, the data source and availability on other platforms can be found in the blog article [url='https://blog.scichart.com/lidar-uav-point-cloud-and-contour-mapping-with-scichart/']at this link.[/url]
